title: Unexpected HTTP Response When No Webapps Deployed
description: The bug report highlights an issue where accessing a URL in a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed results in an unexpected HTTP status code of 200 OK with no content, instead of the anticipated HTTP error 404.
OB: When attempting to access a URL in a Tomcat 7 instance lacking deployed webapps, the actual behavior is not described in the report.
EB: The expected behavior, in this case, should be that when accessing a URL in a Tomcat 7 instance without any webapps deployed, it returns an HTTP error 404 to signify that the resource is not found.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Download the Tomcat 7 instance from 'http://mirror.veriportal.com/apache/tomcat/tomcat7/v7.0.0beta/bin/apachetomcat7.0.0.zip'.
2. Start a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed.
3. Access a URL in this instance, and observe that it returns an HTTP code of 200 OK with no content instead of the expected HTTP error 404.
